page.title: 07FARMING - Continued
page.content: {Tothby Manor}house is 600 years old. Round the whole farm there used to be a medieval village. It is farmed by {Mr G. and Mr R.Willoughby}and employs 2 men. the largest field on the farm is 33 acres. They own{400 acres}which is 152 acres of grassland and 248 acres of cropland. The crops that they grow are wheat, oilseedrape and barley. They have{100 cattle}which each year go for beef. They have 2 sorts of cattle which are good for beef. They are called{Hereford Crosses and a Frech breed which is called a {Limousin.}The machinery that they have are combines, harrows, a caterpillar, a plough, a forklift, a baler and a hay turner. They have a{Plague Stone which used to be at Ulceby Cross when Alford had the plague. People from around villages brought food.
